Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Hi, could someone please tell me how to find out how many `sigid`s a POS assetchain has?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Hi @CrisF There is 64 `segids` https://komodo-platform.readthedocs.io/en/latest/komodo/assetchain-params.html#ac-staked

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Same amount as an amount of squares on chessboard ü§î

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Same amount of notary nodes.... and the same amount of AC in each cluster in the scale test. Its just a good number üòÉ

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thanks @TonyL & @blackjok3r .  I wondering about using ` POSTEST64/createaddrs.sh` (https://github.com/blackjok3rtt/POSTEST64/blob/master/createaddrs.sh) for other POS assetchains like Verus.  Then my server crashed again after an update :/

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Verus uses a diffrent PoS algo, there are no SegID's there

Is the only way to transfer the KMD assets to an Agamawallet every month to claim reward and then reset and reinstall the ledger nano s with new BIP39 words every time though the private aren‚Äôt secure any more. Very problematic and  tediously to that every month!! Is it any other way to claim the reward? Suggestions appreciated!!! üòÅ

Author: Kesoguy [Lv.40]#7341
Content: *private keys aren‚Äôt secure

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: If you want reward, use Agama wallet or Komodo CLI version. If you want security, use Ledger.

Author: Kesoguy [Lv.40]#7341
Content: Exactly what I do. But so tediously to have good security and at the same time want to claim the reward!!! I just bought some KMD yesterday...

Author: Kesoguy [Lv.40]#7341
Content: I always have all my cryptocurrencies on my ledger device.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Ledger doesn't support Komodo active user rewards.

Author: Kesoguy [Lv.40]#7341
Content: Do you know if Trezor or Keepkey does?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: None of them does it
